text: L6.11. LFU Cache Replacement Assume you are given a tiny 4-element, fully-associative cache that uses LFU replacement. The cache stores single byte values (i.e., a line is a single byte). Assume the following: « In case of a tie, replace the item in the earliest position in the cache (e.g,. if the slots are numbered 0O, 1, 2, 3, then in a tie between slots 1 and 3, place the new item in slot 1). « If there are multiple slots empty in the cache, assume that the slot at the earliest position is filled in first. If the cache is empty at the beginning of execution, how many hits will the following string of accesses produce? A,E,B,D,C,G,G,E,A,E,D,A,D,A,D,G,E,C,C,E integer hits @ Save & Grade Single attempt Additional attempts available with new variants @
